CLARYSSE Willy, Egyptian Scribes Writing Greek.

If we find persons writing Greek with a brush, the typical instrument of demotic writing, we can safely assume they must be Egyptians. The evidence for this kind of writing in Greek papyri and ostraca is dated to the third century B.C., and may help us identifying typical features of Greek written by Egyptians. From the second century B.C. onwards, when an Egyptian had to write Greek, he used a Greek kalamos. - P. 196: re-edition of P. Cairo Zenon IV, 59625 + P. Lond. VII, 2093 + 2129 + P.S.I. VI, 563.
